Consideration 4: Assess the use of digital tools and digital skills.

You can assess digital skills through peer feedback, discussions, and self-assessment while utilising digital tools.

Evaluating the teacher’s own competencies is also valuable.

Tip: Recognise that everyone is a learner, and digital skills require the continuous sharing of experiences and knowledge.

Teachers should be aware of digital skills frameworks that help to observe and assess core areas (see more in “3.2 Accessibility & inclusion”).
